definition: to use one's strength to bully the weak (idiom)
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.english: I know you always pery on weak people.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你总是虎视眈眈以强凌弱。

sentences.english: Bullying seems to be a growing trend in schools across the Untied States.
sentences.chinese: 在美国校园里以强凌弱似有增长之势。

definition: see 恃強欺弱|恃强欺弱[shi4 qiang2 qi1 ruo4]
to use one's strength to mistreat people (idiom)/to bully
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. the weak are prey to the strong (idiom); fig. predatory behavior/the law of the jungle
to replace one tyranny by another/to use violence against violence
(fig.) to fight a one-sided battle/to have an unfair advantage in a contest
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
sordid and contemptible (idiom); vile and repulsive (esp. character or action)
